'''Most frequent benign palpebral tumours:'''

*papilloma
*hidrocystoma (lacrimal cyst)
*xanthelesmas (cholesterol deposits)

'''Most frequent malignant palpebral tumours:'''

*<u>Epithelial tumours:</u>
**basal cell carcinoma, which presents a risk of ulceration and local decay
**and more rarely the more aggressive "squamous cell carcinoma" with metastatic potential.

*<Malignant non-epithelial tumours
**malignant melanoma
**MALT lymphoma


'''The signs of malignancy of a palpebral tumour are as follows:'''

* rapid and continuous growth ;
* heterochromia
* tissue invasion ;
* loss of eyelashes (Madarosis);
* for basal cell carcinoma: pearly nodules and telangiectasias.


Management of malignant tumours of the eyelids: this requires the opinion of a multidisciplinary consultation meeting, and can range from removal with simple surveillance (nodular basal cell carcinoma removed in its entirety) to combined radio-chemotherapy depending on the histology and the margins of removal.

question.title: What is a characteristic sign of malignancy in a palpebral tumour?
question.description: A palpebral tumour may exhibit one or more of the following signs of malignancy. Which one is a characteristic sign?

option_a.title: Rapid and continuous growth
option_a.description: A common feature of many tumours, but not exclusive to malignant tumours.

option_b.title: Loss of eyelashes (Madarosis)
option_b.description: A characteristic sign of malignancy in palpebral tumours, especially basal cell carcinoma.

option_c.title: Heterochromia
option_c.description: A condition where the iris has multiple colours, but not necessarily a sign of malignancy.

option_d.title: Pearly nodules and telangiectasias
option_d.description: A characteristic sign of basal cell carcinoma, but not exclusive to malignant tumours.

correct_option.title: string
correct_option.description: The correct answer, which should be one of the options above.
